lead_paragraph: In a documentary, Baron Davis uses a summer basketball league to convey the compassion and the loyalty that allowed him to go from East Los Angeles to the N.B.A. without leaving home.

headline.print_headline: Lifted Up by Love, Not Just Basketball
headline.main: Lifted Up by Love, Not Just Basketball

snippet: In a documentary, Baron Davis uses a summer basketball league to convey the compassion and the loyalty that allowed him to go from East Los Angeles to the N.B.A. without leaving home.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column examines The Drew, documentary film by pro basketball player and director Baron Davis that goes behind scenes at Drew League; summer basketball league in South Central Los Angeles was established in 1973 to help young black players sharpen their skills and form meaningful connections on basketball court.
